Coach Sullivan: "Sid was not cleared for Game 6 by our team doctors. Our team doctors always have the last say before a coach's decision is made. The players' health is a priority for us first."

Video interviews →
DeSmith: https://t.co/eGvjSRGrSC
Marino: https://t.co/TYcE5PhL5a https://t.co/uIAqMCfwxx

Crosby on how much longer he's planning to play in the NHL: "Three, for sure - and then we'll see after that. I don't want to get too far ahead of myself. Three, definitely. I'm glad Geno said three and Tanger said 5+ probably [smiles]. Not surprised at either of those answers."

Crosby on Letang and Malkin: "I think we all feel the same way. We've been fortunate enough to play together for a long time. There's a lot of belief and trust in one another... We understand that it's not something that can happen forever, but hopefully a little bit longer."

Malkin: "I want to be back at the next level next year. I want to play all 82 games. I still want to play in a Final or a semifinal and believe we still have a chance if I stay here. We have a great organization, great coach, and we still have a chance to win." https://t.co/xeuO4vAxzz
Letang on career longevity: "I feel really good. My body has been great for the last few years. I see myself for four or five more years, easily... Off-ice training is a big part of the player I am."
Letang on contract conversations: "As far as contracts, me and Hexy were clear that we were not mentioning anything to anyone. It stays between me and the team."

Coach Sullivan on Rust: "He has been a really valuable player for our team. He is one of our more versatile players. I think he's really evolved with his leadership skills. Like Guentzel and Dumoulin - they've become part of the leadership group that has been established here."

Coach Sullivan on Crosby, Malkin, and Letang: "There's a reason these three guys have played for the same organization for as long as they have. They have established the standard for what it means to be a Pittsburgh Penguin."

Coach Sullivan on playoff performance: "I feel as though our team played extremely well. There's such a fine line between winning and losing. None of us feel very good about the result at this point. Never once in that round did we feel like we were getting outplayed."

Matheson on Letang: "He was one of the guys I always looked up to growing up - and watched his game. It was definitely a pinch-myself moment being able to play with him, especially in the playoffs. I thought we played well together."

DeSmith: “Physically, I’m doing okay. I had surgery 10 or 11 days ago… Mentally, obviously really frustrating… It was something I was really looking forward to [the playoffs]. It would’ve stung a little less had we gotten out of the first round and gotten past the Rangers.”

Dumoulin on his injury: "It's tough. It's difficult having no control in the game and just watching it. I injured my MCL. It was a grade-3 tear. It happened on that disallowed goal. My knee hit the post and hyperextended."

Kapanen: "It is a privilege to play with these guys and see them every day... They are basically my brothers. I am lucky to be part of this team."

Video interviews →
McGinn: https://t.co/Yvic6lrWe4
Ruhwedel: https://t.co/m7hBHQ3a39
Zucker: https://t.co/FtjNvQduFb https://t.co/RzGiVkiv2o

Malkin exiting the interview room: "Potash, love you!"

Potash: "Yes, I know."
Malkin: "Pittsburgh is my second hometown. I've been here 16 years. It's hard to understand what's going on right now - we just lost a couple days ago. I hope we find a way to all be happy."

Malkin: "I love this city and I love these fans so much. If this team wants new blood and young guys and they say to me to move on, we will see... I believe in my agent and I trust him. I want to stay here. I want to play in the NHL... I hope I stay here. I hope I retire here."

Malkin on playing with Crosby and Letang: "It's amazing. They are like my two brothers, one Canadian, and one French Canadian. It's not just hockey, it's life. We spend so much time together. Sid is an amazing guy. He's my favorite player, my favorite guy."

Malkin walking into the interview room with a big smile: "Potash, love you."

Potash: "Love you back."
Love thy linemate 💛🖤 https://t.co/9B5gszD8wW
DeSmith on watching the Penguins get the win in triple overtime after leaving Game 1: "It definitely made the injury for me hurt a lot less. It was fun watching Louis do his thing out there."

DeSmith: "I had been dealing with a groin issue for about a month in a half. I think it was double OT and fatigue. I made a movement and felt my hip and groin go all at once... It was a pretty easy decision to come out of the game when I couldn't really go down or move."

Rust: "Not one time did I think we were going to lose. Obviously, I was wrong."

Video interviews →
Carter: https://t.co/dB5nG8fXao
Rodrigues: https://t.co/5I9KnZnytE
Heinen: https://t.co/IUbMcKZrU8 https://t.co/AP6j0Rk54r

Pettersson on his helmet coming off in Game 7: "I think it was one of those plays when it came off - I can't say if it was intentional or not... In the heat of the moment, I tried to get to the bench and get a change in. It was an unfortunate play."

Kapanen on Malkin: "I love this guy. I don't know what else to tell you. You never know what you're going to get with him at practice. He's a funny guy. Very relaxed. He's a monster out there. I'd love to play with him again. It's been an absolute honor to play with him."
Kapanen on what he has to do moving forward: "I need to get my confidence back - getting my swagger I used to have. It wasn't there this year and I think that showed."
Guys, he was joking.
Zucker on Rust (completely deadpan): "I've told him his entire career, he's got zero skill, zero talent... He turned it around."

Zucker on his health: "Everybody's got something going on in the playoffs. For me, it was just trying to manage it as best as I could to help the team win... It was one of those things for me this year - I couldn't stay ahead of it."

McGinn on Crosby, Letang, and Malkin: "Growing up, I watched them all play. It was pretty cool to play with them. They bring their work ethic to the rink every day. I think that's what good leaders do. They are amazing to watch and play with."
McGinn: "At the end of the day, it's a tough way to lose. It will just make everyone hungrier next year."

Rakell: "It was just a tough series. It felt so even. It felt like different things happened in every game that changed the scene of how the momentum was going... It did feel like we played a great series and we had a good chance to win." https://t.co/6H2KpSIVlZ
Rust: "I'm not looking to rob anyone, I just want what I deem is fair - a reasonable contract. I think and I hope - I'd like to think something is going to get worked out here."

Rust on potential contract extensions: "First of all, I'd love to return to the team. I love it here. Pittsburgh is a place that I've been for a while and I have a lot of memories in. I started my family here. I'd like to make something work to come back here."
Carter on his teammates: "I think this is probably one of the hardest working teams I've ever been around. It's been a pleasure playing with them."
Carter on the playoffs: "I thought we had a team that could do it. If you look at the first round, we played a lot of good hockey... I thought the guys left it all out there and battled hard."

Carter on changes in the offseason: "There's obviously a lot of questions around that. A lot of the core guys are up in the air right now. As a player, you want everyone to be back... Unfortunately, that's just how things go sometimes. We just have to see how things shake out."

Rodrigues: "We had our ups and downs, just like every team has. We fought hard throughout. Even into the playoffs, we gave it our all... Everyone is pushing for each other. I can't say enough good things about every guy in that room. It didn't end the way we wanted it to."

Rodrigues: "The players inside that locker room are the best bunch of guys I've ever played with. This is a great place for me and my family. My kids love it here... There hasn't been anything [regarding a contract] yet. We'll see where the summer takes us."

Rakell on playing in Pittsburgh: "It was a great experience for me. I've learned a lot from a lot of players and coaches here. This team has a lot of potential. This is definitely a place I would like to come back to - where I think I can take my game to the next level."

Brian Boyle underwent successful knee surgery today.
 
The procedure on Boyle’s left knee was performed by team physician Dr. Dharmesh Vyas at UPMC Presbyterian-Shadyside.
 
Boyle, who was injured on May 13 in Game 6 against the NYR, has an expected recovery time of six weeks. https://t.co/aWTZZb1Qoz
Sidney Crosby speaks to the media after Game 7 ⬇️ https://t.co/JQ7dVLTuqV

Jarry: "Casey and Louis did a great job, but obviously you want to be in there and battling with them every night. That's something that hurt the most, is just not being able to be out there and go to battle with the guys."

More from @PensInsideScoop: https://t.co/FYRaMOh8jc https://t.co/WneR3qO7a8

Guentzel: “It’s disappointing. We’re right there. We put ourselves in a good spot, being up 3-1. Just disappointing to think about that we had a lead in each game and gave that away. Just an amazing group. We believed the whole time. It just didn’t go our way.” https://t.co/ropNhLjJJR

Coach Sullivan: “Never once did I feel on the bench like we were under siege, or we were in trouble, or we were on our heels. The feeling behind the bench was that we were in control of the game, we were playing on our toes, we were playing the game the right way.” https://t.co/yqQIxAdxX3

The bond that they've created throughout the team and throughout management think is something that's irreplaceable. It's a business, but I think that if they're able to come back, they definitely well. There's a bond between them and I think that's unbreakable.”

Jarry on it potentially being the last game with Crosby, Letang, and Malkin playing together: “It’s something you never want to think about. They’re generational players and Pittsburgh's lucky enough to have three of them for the last 15 years…

Coach Sullivan on his players: "I can't say enough about this group of players, I just think the world of them. They are a privilege to coach. I know how much they care and how hard they play. I love coaching these guys. It stings when you lose because you care so much."

Coach Sullivan on Pettersson's skating off the ice after losing his helmet: "He has to come off by the rule."

Media: "How do you feel about the rule?"
